name: Describe and draw triangles and quadrilaterals 1

skills.name: Given the name of a rectangle, draw or identify a corresponding diagram
Given the name of a rhombus, draw or identify a corresponding diagram
Given the name of an equilateral triangle, draw or identify a corresponding diagram
Given the name of an isosceles triangle, draw or identify a corresponding diagram
Given the name of a right-angled triangle, draw or identify a corresponding diagram

explanations.A: This is a parallelogram, a shape with two pairs of parallel sides shown by the arrow notation. A rectangle is a four-sided shape with four right-angles and opposite sides equal in length. Do any of the shapes shown have these properties?
explanations.B: This is a rectangle as it has four sides, four right-angles and the opposite sides are equal in length.
explanations.C: This is a rhombus. A rectangle is a four-sided shape with four right-angles and opposite sides equal in length. Do any of the shapes shown have these properties?
explanations.D: One of the shapes shown is a rectangle... A rectangle is a four-sided shape with four right-angles and opposite sides equal in length. Which shape has these properties?

explanations.A: This is a rectangle as it has four sides, four right-angles and the opposite sides are equal in length.
explanations.B: This is a rhombus. A rectangle is a four-sided shape with four right-angles and opposite sides equal in length. Do any of the shapes shown have these properties?
explanations.C: This is a parallelogram, a shape with two pairs of parallel sides shown by the arrow notation. A rectangle is a four-sided shape with four right-angles and opposite sides equal in length. Do any of the shapes shown have these properties?
explanations.D: One of the shapes shown is a rectangle... A rectangle is a four-sided shape with four right-angles and opposite sides equal in length. Which shape has these properties?

explanations.A: This is an equilateral triangle. An equilateral triangle has three equal sides and three equal angles. We can tell from the diagram that each side is equal as they all have two marks on and each angle is equal as they each have one mark on.
explanations.B: This is an isosceles triangle. An isosceles triangle has two equal sides and two equal angles. We can tell two sides are equal as they have matching marks on and two angles are equal as they also have matching marks. An equilateral triangle has three equal angles and three equal sides. Which of the diagrams shows all sides being equal and all angles?
explanations.C: This is a right-angled triangle as the right-angle has been highlighted. We are looking for an equilateral triangle where all three sides are equal. Which of the triangles shown has notation highlighting that the sides are all equal?
explanations.D: One of the shapes shown is an equilateral triangle... An equilateral triangle has three equal sides and three equal angles. Which shape has these properties highlighted?

explanations.A: This is an isosceles triangle. An isosceles triangle has two equal sides and two equal angles. We can tell two sides are equal as they have matching marks on and two angles are equal as they also have matching marks. An equilateral triangle has three equal angles and three equal sides. Which of the diagrams shows all sides being equal and all angles?
explanations.B: This is a right-angled triangle as the right-angle has been highlighted. We are looking for an equilateral triangle where all three sides are equal. Which of the triangles shown has notation highlighting that the sides are all equal?
explanations.C: This is an equilateral triangle. An equilateral triangle has three equal sides and three equal angles. We can tell from the diagram that each side is equal as they all have two marks on and each angle is equal as they each have one mark on.
explanations.D: One of the shapes shown is an equilateral triangle... An equilateral triangle has three equal sides and three equal angles. Which shape has these properties highlighted?

explanations.A: This is a scalene triangle - a triangle with no sides of equal length. An isosceles triangle has two equal sides and two equal angles. Which of the shapes shown has notation highlighting that two sides are equal and two angles are equal?
explanations.B: This is an isosceles triangle. This type of triangle has two equal sides and two equal angles. We can tell two sides are equal as they have matching marks on and two angles are equal as they also have matching marks.
explanations.C: This is a right-angled triangle as the right-angle has been highlighted. We are looking for an isosceles triangle where two sides are equal in length and two angles are equal. Which of the shapes shown has notation highlighting that two sides are equal and two angles are equal?
explanations.D: One of the shapes shown is an isosceles triangle... This type of triangle has two equal sides and two equal angles. Which shape has these properties highlighted?

explanations.A: This is an isosceles triangle. This type of triangle has two equal sides and two equal angles. We can tell two sides are equal as they have matching marks on and two angles are equal as they also have matching marks.
explanations.B: This is a right-angled triangle as the right-angle has been highlighted. We are looking for an isosceles triangle where two sides are equal in length and two angles are equal. Which of the shapes shown has notation highlighting that two sides are equal and two angles are equal?
explanations.C: This is a scalene triangle - a triangle with no sides of equal length. An isosceles triangle has two equal sides and two equal angles. Which of the shapes shown has notation highlighting that two sides are equal and two angles are equal?
explanations.D: One of the shapes shown is an isosceles triangle... This type of triangle has two equal sides and two equal angles. Which shape has these properties highlighted?

explanations.A: This is a scalene triangle - a triangle with equal sides or angles. A right-angled triangle has one 90° angle. Which shape has this property labelled?
explanations.B: This is an isosceles triangle. A right-angled triangle has one 90° angle. Which shape has this property labelled?
explanations.C: This is a right-angled triangle, we can tell as the 90° angle has been labelled.
explanations.D: One of the shapes shown is a right-angled triangle... This type of triangle has one 90° angle. Which shape has this property labelled?

explanations.A: This is an isosceles triangle. A right-angled triangle has one 90° angle. Which shape has this property labelled?
explanations.B: This is a right-angled triangle, we can tell as the 90° angle has been labelled.
explanations.C: This is a scalene triangle - a triangle with equal sides or angles. A right-angled triangle has one 90° angle. Which shape has this property labelled?
explanations.D: One of the shapes shown is a right-angled triangle... This type of triangle has one 90° angle. Which shape has this property labelled?

explanations.A: This is a parallelogram, a shape with two pairs of parallel sides shown by the arrow notation. A rhombus is a four-sided shape all of whose sides are equal in length.
explanations.B: This is a rectangle as it has four sides, four right-angles and the opposite sides are equal in length. A rhombus is a four-sided shape all of whose sides are equal.
explanations.C: This is a rhombus as it is a four-sided shape with four sides equal in length. There are two, matching marks on each side to show they are all equal.
explanations.D: One of the shapes shown is a rhombus... A rhombus is a shape with four sides of equal length. Which shape has this property labelled?

explanations.A: This is a rhombus as it is a four-sided shape with four sides equal in length. There are two, matching marks on each side to show they are all equal.
explanations.B: This is a kite as it has four sides, two sets of adjacent equal sides and one pair of opposite angles. A rhombus is a four-sided shape all of whose sides are equal.
explanations.C: This is a rectangle as it has four sides, four right-angles and the opposite sides are equal in length. A rhombus is a four-sided shape all of whose sides are equal.
explanations.D: This is a trapezium as it has one pair of parallel sides. A rhombus is a four-sided shape all of whose sides are equal.
